alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 6:37AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN ON TOP OF FRESH SNOW AND ICE... Heavy rain is expected to follow snow and wintry mix that are currently progressing from south to north over the Panhandle. The transition from to rain will follow that same pattern as warm air behind the front moves in from the south. Rain will become heavy at times on Wednesday and persist through Thursday night. The primary concern is not snow totals, but rather heavy rain on top of fresh snow and pre-existing snow and ice. With the ground still frozen, runoff will become excessive, overloading storm drains and culverts quickly. Additionally, ponding of water on roadways will create hazardous driving conditions. Ponding of water on airport runways will also impact aviation operations. Daily rainfall totals will be well above normal for this time of the year and may result in new daily precipitation records.
